column98: Senior Maintenance Coordinator THOR Offshore Windfarm
column99:
RWE is building Denmark’s largest offshore wind farm. Thor offshore wind farm will be built 22 kilometres off the coast of Thorsminde on the west coast of Jutland with a capacity of more than 1 GW. 72 units of Siemens Gamesa’s flagship SG 14-236 DD offshore wind turbines are planned to be installed. Once fully operational in 2027, Thor will produce green electricity to more than 1 million Danish households. 
 Task of the role 
 You will be the maintenance coordinator for the offshore teams with main responsibility for ensuring the safe and smooth operation of the Thor wind farm together with the associated substations. The maintenance coordinator will be working closely together with the production manager, engineering teams, warehouse coordinator and the technicians. 
 The maintenance coordinator will ensure correct planning, worksite preparation and management of the offshore day to day business with the capability to inspire people to take responsibility and diligence for the planned tasks. 
 During the construction phase of the wind farm the maintenance coordinator will be supporting the Commissioning team and assist in the organisation build up for the upcoming operation. Onshore rotation is planned for 1 week on/off with accommodation facilities provided if required. 
 Your future plans 
 
 Ensuring the "Zero Incident Policy" and compliance with the specifications regarding occupational health, safety and environmental protection 
 Monitoring and operation of the technical systems of the offshore wind farm and substations by means of control technology and monitoring systems 
 Participating in troubleshooting at the wind turbines and substations 
 First contact and remote support of the offshore technicians in carrying out fault clearance and maintenance work 
 Responsible for the optimal planning and monitoring of the transfer of personnel to and within the offshore wind farms using crew transfer vessels (CTV) and helicopters 
 Creation, allocation, evaluation and archiving of digital work orders in SAP PM 
 Responsible for the local control room with close corporation ink. Hand-over procedures with the central control room (CCR) witch is occupied 24/7 
 Preparation of RAMS (risk assessments and method statements) for repairs, as well as control of RAMS by external service providers 
 Occasional On- call duty during night time in case of an emergency 
 
 Your profile 
 
 Solid HSEQ awareness and knowledge of relevant laws, norms, and standards 
 Experienced in vocational training, particularly in electrical engineering 
 +10 years of relevant work experience in the operational management of an offshore wind farm 
 Advance technical knowledge within troubleshooting on wind turbines 
 Experiences in the field of protection systems, SCADA, communication, automation technology and network operations 
 Experience with switching operations on HV equipment 
 Advanced operational knowledge of ship logistics 
 Skilled planning, organisational and communication skills 
 Engaged team player with a positive and solution-oriented mindset 
 Good IT skills (e.g. MS Office, etc.) 
 Good English language skill 
 Be able to work offshore including GWO and HUET certificates 
 
 From here, you benefit from many further advantages – Curious? Then click  here !   
 Apply with just a few clicks:  ad code  89221,  application period  2025-02-23. Any questions?  Contact HR:  Magnus Aarenstrup, magnus.aarenstrup@rwe.com #LI-MA1 We look forward to meeting you. Of course, you can find us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, YouTube and Xing, too. We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of gender, disability, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, age, sexual orientation, and identity. #inclusionmatters RWE Offshore Wind will play a central role in realising our purpose and vision so far being the No.2 generator globally. The company’s 3,500+ experts operate more than 1.000 fixed bottom and floating wind turbines in 19 wind farms. And we plan to increase our capacity from the current 3.3 GW to 10 GW by 2030 (RWE’s share). In connection with current projects in development as well as upcoming auctions in Europe, the United States, and the Asia-Pacific region, RWE Offshore Wind is preparing to implement further complex projects. RWE Offshore Wind tests a wide variety of new technologies in our offshore wind farms, enabling these plants to operate more efficiently and economically. In addition, we are involved in and committed to numerous programmes and initiatives that are designed to accelerate innovation in offshore wind and promote the development of new industry standards which allows you to have the freedom to act with conviction and courage as we pivot to new technologies – and continuously improve, together. 
 Want to learn more about working for RWE Offshore? Join  Our Journey Offshore  by watching the miniseries including 6 episodes, 5 ambassadors and one exciting trip Offshore.
